# Simulation

## $latex \phi = (-1, 1)^T$

### Parameters

```{r params-misq1, echo=FALSE}
retval <- readLines("misq1.params.R",warn=FALSE)
for (i in 1:length(retval)) {
  cat(retval[i])
  cat("\n")
}
```

- $latex S_i(t)$ distributed as $latex N(0,1)$, where $latex i = 1, 2, \cdots, \mbox{data.ncol}$ and $latex t = 1, 2, \cdots,  \mbox{data.length}$.

```{r qqnorm-misq1, echo=FALSE}
source("pre.R")
source("misq1.params.R")
misq1 <- new("MISQ", phi)
x <- matrix(rnorm(data.length * data.ncol), data.length, data.ncol)
sim.dist <- dist(x, misq1)
qqnorm(sim.dist, main=expression(paste("The Q-Q plot of ", hat(D)[phi](S[i], S[j]))))
qqline(sim.dist)
retval <- shapiro.test(sim.dist)
print(paste("The p-value of Shapiro-Wilk normality test is", round(retval$p.value, 3)))
if (retval$p.value < 0.05) {
  print((paste("It is significant that the distance estimator is not normal distributed")))
} else {
  print((paste("There is no evidence to say the distance estimator is not normal distributed")))
} 
```
